sense.name: Put down by force, intimidation, or authority, as of a person; correct by punishment or discipline.
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1[agent] SUBDUE NP2 Note: Use this sense for all instances of one human being (or group) acting with authority over another human being or group.
sense.examples: The government subdues any attempt of an uprising. Our wishes have to be subdued to those of the ruler. The police subdued the suspect and placed him in handcuffs.

sense.name: Hold within limits and control, deal with successfully, as of a task or object.
sense.examples: He subdued his shyness. He reignited the inflation that Thatcher had subdued.
